value.description: A database connection URL used to connect to a database. May contain database system name, host, port, database name and some parameters. The exact syntax of a database connection URL is specified by your DBMS.
value.name: Database Connection URL

value.description: Database driver class name
value.name: Database Driver Class Name

value.description: Optional database driver jar file path url. For example 'file:///var/tmp/mariadb-java-client-1.1.7.jar'
value.name: Database Driver Jar Url

value.description: Database user name
value.name: Database User

value.description: The password for the database user
value.name: Password

value.description: Query to be used when testing the Datasource.
value.name: Validation Query

value.description: The maximum amount of time that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before failing, or -1 to wait indefinitely.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.
value.name: Max Total Connections

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties.
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties.
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain connection to database
value.name: Database Connection Pooling Service

value.description: System category of the feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed name

value.description: Specifies the standard table type to drop or ALL for standard set.
value.name: Table Type

value.description: Additional tables to drop separated by comma.
value.name: Additional Tables

value.description: Specifies the standard table type to create or ALL for standard set.
value.name: Table Type

value.description: Pipe-delim format with the specifications for the fields (column name|data type|comment
value.name: Field specification

value.description: Provide list of partition columns column-delimited
value.name: Partition specification

value.description: Provide format and delimiter specification. This is the full clause starting with the INPUTFORMAT such as: INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TextInputFormat' OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.HiveIgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat'
value.name: Feed Table Storage Format

value.description: Provide storage format specification for the target tables
value.name: Target Table Format

value.description: TblProperties clause generally specificying the compression option
value.name: Target Table Properties

value.description: Specify the full HDFS root path for the feed,valid,invalid tables.
value.name: Feed Root Path

value.description: Specify the HDFS folder root path for creating the master table
value.name: Master Root Path

allowableValues.description: An implemenation that stores metadata locally in memory (for development-only)
An implementation that accesses metadata via the metadata service REST API

value.description: Specifies which implementation of the metadata providers should be used
value.name: Implementation

value.description: The base URL to the metadata server when the REST API client implementation is chosen.
value.name: rest-client-url

value.description: Optional user name if the client requires a credential
value.name: client-username

value.description: Optional password if the client requires a credential
value.name: client-password

value.description: The Controller Service to obtain the SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Think Big metadata service
value.name: Metadata Service

value.description: System category of the feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed category

value.description: Name of feed this processor supports
value.name: System feed name

allowableValues.description: Retry initialization (if the appropriate time delay has expired) and penalize the flow file.

value.description: Indicates how this processor should behave when a flow file arrives after feed initialization has failed.
value.name: Initialization Failure Strategy

value.description: The minimum amount of seconds to delay before an arriving flow file should trigger another attempt to initialize a feed that has previously failed initialization. Any flow file arriving before this delay has expired will be immediately failed.
value.name: Initialization Retry Delay (seconds)

value.description: The maximum number of times initialization will be retried where there are failures. There is no limit if unset.
value.name: Max Initialization Attempts

value.description: The engine to execute scripts
value.name: Script Engine

value.name: Script File

value.description: Body of script to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used
value.name: Script Body

value.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain modules required by the script.
value.name: Module Directory

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed to be processed
relationships.name: failure

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties.
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties.
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The full HDFS directory(s) to create separated by newline
value.name: Directory

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Path to the JAR file containing the Spark job application
value.name: ApplicationJAR

value.name: Extra JARs

value.description: Qualified classname of the Spark job application class
value.name: MainClass

value.description: Comma separated arguments to be passed into the main as args
value.name: MainArgs

value.description: The Spark master
value.name: SparkMaster

value.description: Qualified classname of the Spark job application class
value.name: SparkHome

value.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running SQL select query , zero means there is no limit. Max time less than 1 second will be equal to zero.
value.name: Max Wait Time

value.description: How much RAM to allocate to the driver
value.name: Driver Memory

value.description: How much RAM to allocate to the executor
value.name: Executor Memory

value.description: The number of exectors to be used
value.name: Number of Executors

value.description: The name of the spark application
value.name: Spark Application Name

value.description: The number of executor cores to be used
value.name: Executor Cores

value.description: Default timeout for all network interactions. This config will be used in place of spark.core.connection.ack.wait.timeout, spark.akka.timeout, spark.storage.blockManagerSlaveTimeoutMs, spark.shuffle.io.connectionTimeout, spark.rpc.askTimeout or spark.rpc.lookupTimeout if they are not configured.
value.name: Network Timeout

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Optional Yarn Queue
value.name: Yarn Queue
